content.user_title: Work with PDF files in Python
content.value_statement: PDF files require complex tools for extraction and manipulation. This skill provides comprehensive code examples using popular Python libraries for all PDF operations.
actual_capabilities: Extract text from PDFs with layout preservation
Extract tables and structured data from documents
Create PDFs programmatically with text, images, and tables
Fill and modify PDF forms automatically
Merge multiple PDFs or split documents by pages
Add watermarks, annotations, and page numbers
limitations: Requires Python environment with library installations
System dependencies needed for OCR (tesseract, poppler)
Cannot edit scanned PDFs without OCR processing

best_practices: Validate PDF files before processing and handle encryption errors
Use the right library for each task (pdfplumber for tables, reportlab for creation)

anti_patterns: Attempting to process encrypted PDFs without checking for passwords
Using basic text extraction on scanned documents without OCR
Skipping error handling when processing multiple PDF files

faq.question: Which Python library should I use for basic PDF operations?
faq.answer: Use pypdf for merging, splitting, rotating, and metadata. Use pdfplumber for text and table extraction with layout awareness.

faq.question: What are the size limits for PDF processing?
faq.answer: Processing limits depend on available memory. The skill includes guidance for handling large files by processing in chunks.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing Python code?
faq.answer: Copy the relevant functions from the helper script or reference files into your project. All code uses standard libraries available via pip.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally in your Python environment. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my scanned PDF returning empty text?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs contain images, not selectable text. Use the OCR functions with pytesseract and pdf2image to extract text.

faq.question: How does this compare to online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This provides programmatic control for automation and batch processing. Online tools offer convenience, while this skill enables integration into workflows.
